intro: Olearia lacunosa, commonly known as the New Zealand frostflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with silver-grey foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subalpine regions. Olearia lacunosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
